alert.note: Alert for Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 11 at 2:21PM EST until November 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following county, Watauga. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 214 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 3 to locally 7 inches of rain have fallen since last night. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beech Mountain, Foscoe, Seven Devils, Rominger and Lovill. Multiple reports have been received of flooding along the Watauga River in the communities of Valle Crucis and Sugar Grove, with water covering roads and approaching nearby homes.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
